thread.title: Reality TV star's site hacked by Anonymous
thread.title_full: Reality TV star's site hacked by Anonymous

title: Reality TV star's site hacked by Anonymous
text:
Reality TV star's site hacked by Anonymous Last updated 13:04, February 18 2017 SUPPLIED 
Dance Moms reality TV star Abby Lee Miller has fallen prey to an online hack. 
Dance Moms star Abby Lee Miller has had her website hacked by people claiming to be hacking group Anonymous. 
Miller is a US dance instructor who heads the hit reality series Dance Moms . 
On Saturday, the online store section of her Abby Lee Dance Company site was replaced by a hacking message. STORE.ABBYLEEDANCECOMPANY.COM 
The hackers, who claimed to be Anonymous, targeted the online shop section of her site. 
Miller is a dance instructor, choreographer, and the director and owner of Reign Dance Productions. She is also the founder of the Abby Lee Dance Company. 
READ MORE: 
Her reality show follows her young students and their involved mothers, who attend practices and performances and openly clash with the brash Miller over her criticism of their daughters. ELIZABETH DALEY/REUTERS 
Miller was charged last year with illegally trying to hide US$775,000 ($1.097 million) worth of income. She entered a guilty plea to bankruptcy fraud but is yet to be sentenced. 
Miller is currently embroiled in a bankruptcy fraud case. 
Miller was charged last year with illegally trying to hide US$775,000 ($1.079 million) worth of income. 
Prosecutors say Miller was dishonest and only fessed up to her real income after a bankruptcy judge saw her on TV in 2012 and figured she had to be lying. They're seeking a prison sentence of up to 30 months. BRENDON THORNE/REUTERS 
Abby Lee Miller (back, third from right) and the cast from Dance Moms. 
Meanwhile, Miller's attorneys say she simply got caught up in her fame and fortune, but always intended to repay her debts. They're seeking probation. 
She pleaded guilty to the charges but is yet to be sentenced. - Stuff
